text: is there a way for me to destroy a tag that I published or change it because I have the wrong version in the Project file?

elements.text: is there a way for me to destroy a tag that I published or change it because I have the wrong version in the Project file?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Yes, you can delete tags on GitHub. You can't delete versions uploaded to Julia's registry - if you made a mistake, just release a patch

elements.text: Yes, you can delete tags on GitHub. You can't delete versions uploaded to Julia's registry - if you made a mistake, just release a patch

text: if you don't create the tag (which you should _*not*_ do manually _*before*_ registration), you don't have to delete it :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: if you don't create the tag (which you should
registration), you don't have to delete it

text: Why not create the tag before? JuliaHub asks for a tag when adding a new version

elements.text: Why not create the tag before? JuliaHub asks for a tag when adding a new version

text: because TagBot will create the tag _after_ successful registration.  if you make a mistake (and Dan made a few of them :slightly_smiling_face:) and need to retrigger registration, then it's a mess
